{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with left flank pain radiating to the abdomen and groin, along with pink tinge to her urine. These symptoms are consistent with renal colic, which is commonly caused by kidney stones. The patient also has several months of fatigue and constipation, which may be related to the underlying cause of her kidney stones. On exam, her blood pressure is slightly elevated, and blood studies show increased PTH and hypercalcemia.
